CONJUGATES: plump (adj.), plumper (comp. adj.), plumpest (sup. adj.) | plump (v.), plumps (v. 3rd sg present), plumping (v. present participle), plumped (v. past tense/past participle)
ETYMOLOGY: Late Middle English. Probably imitative of a sudden, heavy fall. The sense 'rounded, full' emerged in the 16th century, likely from the idea of something falling or swelling into a rounded shape.
SINCE: Late Middle English (verb from late 14th century, adjective from early 16th century)

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: Adjective: A word or phrase naming an attribute, added to or grammatically related to a noun to modify or describe it.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: Having a full, rounded shape; somewhat fat in a pleasant and healthy way.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 丰满的；圆胖的；饱满的（常指健康或可爱的胖）
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The baby had plump, rosy cheeks and tiny hands.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 那个婴儿有着丰满红润的脸颊和细小的手。

MEANINGS.PATTERN: plump [sth] up | plump up [sth] | plump out [sth] | plump [sth]
MEANINGS.POS_TIP: Transitive verb: A verb that takes one or more objects. | Intransitive verb: A verb that does not take a direct object.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: To make something fatter, fuller, or softer by patting or shaking it; or to become fatter, fuller, or softer.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: （通过拍打或摇晃）使…鼓起；使…蓬松；使…丰满；（自己）变丰满；鼓起
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: She plumped up the cushions on the sofa before her guests arrived.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 客人们到来之前，她把沙发上的垫子拍松了。

MEANINGS.PATTERN: plump [sth] down | plump down | plump into [sth]
MEANINGS.POS_TIP: Intransitive verb: A verb that does not take a direct object. | Transitive verb: A verb that takes one or more objects.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: To drop or fall heavily and suddenly; to put something down heavily and without care.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 猛然落下；砰地放下；突然跌坐
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: He plumped his heavy bag down on the desk with a sigh.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 他叹了口气，砰地把沉重的包放在桌子上。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: Adverb: A word or phrase that modifies an adjective, verb, or other adverb, expressing a relation of place, time, circumstance, manner, cause, degree, etc.
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The cat jumped plump onto the unsuspecting mouse.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 那只猫猛地扑向了毫无防备的老鼠。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: Noun: A word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things (common noun), or to name a particular one of these (proper noun).
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A heavy, sudden fall or drop; the sound made by such a fall.
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: With a plump, the heavy book landed on the wooden floor.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 随着一声闷响，那本厚重的书掉到了木地板上。
